div.p: The official URL for this implementation guide is:

valueMarkdown.value: Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on HL7 Terminology
Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on the HL7 Extension Pack

description.value: Concepts required in recommendations that are not defined elsewhere

name.value: Daily Assessment of the Duration of Antibiotic Therapy

description.value: All Antibiotics are daily re-evaluated for the Duration of Therapy for each Antibiotic.

name.value: Daily Assessment of the Focus for Antibiotics

description.value: All Antibiotics are daily re-evaluated for the Focus for each Antibiotic.

name.value: Daily Assessment of the Indication for Antibiotics

description.value: All Antibiotics are daily re-evaluated for the Indication for each Antibiotic.

name.value: Daily Assessments of Readiness-to-wean from mechanical ventilation

description.value: Readiness-to-wean from mechanical ventilation is assessed periodically every day.
Treatment Goals should be documented daily for every Intensive Care Patient.

name.value: Daily Evaluation of Readiness-to-Wean and/or Weaning Trials

description.value: All invasive ventilated Intensive Care Patients should be evaluated for their readiness-to-wean and/or receive weaning trials at least once every day.
Mobilization that occurs at least once a day.
Every Intensive Care Patient should be visited daily in multiprofessional ward rounds led by an intensive care specialist.
Every Intensive Care Patient is visited daily in multiprofessional ward rounds led by an intensive care specialist.
All invasive devices have a daily re-evaluation regarding the necessity of each device.
Daily Treatment Goals are set at least once every day.
Weaning trials are performed periodically every day.
Delirium should be assessed once between 6 AM and <2 PM every day.
Delirium should be assessed once between 2 AM and <10 PM every day.
Delirium should be assessed once between 10 PM and <6 AM every day.

name.value: Discharge with dependence on home ventilation

description.value: The fraction of patients discharged with dependence on home ventilation should be low.
DIVI Quality Indicator 1: Daily multiprofessional ward rounds with documentation of treatment goals
DIVI Quality Indicator 2: Management of Sedation, Analgesia and Delirium
DIVI Quality Indicator 3: Patient-adapted Ventilation
DIVI Quality Indicator 4: Early Weaning from Invasive Ventilation
DIVI Quality Indicator 5: Infection Prevention
DIVI Quality Indicator 6: Infection Management
DIVI Quality Indicator 7: Patient-adapted Clinical Nutrition
DIVI Quality Indicator 8: Structured Communication with Patients and Relatives
DIVI Quality Indicator 9: Early Mobilization

name.value: DIVI Sektion Qualit채tsverbesserung und Informationstechnologie Qualit채tsindikatoren Semantik

description.value: DIVI Sektion Qualit채tsverbesserung und Informationstechnologie Qualit채tsindikatoren Semantik
Driving Pressure should be limited to a maximum of 15 cmH2O in all invasive ventilated ICU patients with severe ARDS.
All Intensive Care Patients for which a sufficient oral nutrition is not expected on day one should be started on enteral feeding within 24 hours.

name.value: First Communication with Patients and/or their Relatives within 72 hours

description.value: An initial structured communication with the Patients and/or their Relatives occurs within 72 hours of Admission to Intensive Care.
First Enteral Feeding occurs within 24 hours after Admission to Intensive Care.
First Mobilization occurs within 24 hours after Admission to Intensive Care.
The Frequency of Blood Cultures should be at least 80 per 1000 days.
The Frequency of Blood Cultures is at least 80 per 1000 days.
The consumption of hand disinfectant should be more than 80 litres per 1000 days.

name.value: Indication, Focus and Duration of Therapy for Antibiotics

description.value: All Intensive Care Patients with Antibiotics should have a daily re-evaluation of the Indication, Focus and Duration of Therapy for each Antibiotic.
The number of infections per invasive devices is at zero.
All Intensive Care Patients should be mobilized within 24 hours after admission to ICU.

name.value: Inital Structured Communication with Patients and/or Relatives

description.value: For all Intensive Care Patients, an initial structured communication with the Patients and/or their Relatives should take place within 72 hours of Admission to Intensive Care.
The patient is not discharged with home ventilation.
Pain should be assessed once between 6 AM and <2 PM every day.
Pain should be assessed once between 2 AM and <10 PM every day.
Pain should be assessed once between 10 PM and <6 AM every day.
PEEP should be adjusted according to the table on ardsnet.org in dependence of the FiO2 required to achieve adequate oxygenation in all ventilated ICU patients with severe ARDS.
PEEP should be adjusted according to the table on ardsnet.org in dependence of the FiO2 required to achieve adequate oxygenation in all ventilated ICU patients with severe ARDS.
PEEP should be adjusted according to the table on ardsnet.org in dependence of the FiO2 required to achieve adequate oxygenation in all ventilated ICU patients with severe ARDS.
PEEP should be adjusted according to the table on ardsnet.org in dependence of the FiO2 required to achieve adequate oxygenation in all ventilated ICU patients with severe ARDS.
PEEP should be adjusted according to the table on ardsnet.org in dependence of the FiO2 required to achieve adequate oxygenation in all ventilated ICU patients with severe ARDS.
PEEP should be adjusted according to the table on ardsnet.org in dependence of the FiO2 required to achieve adequate oxygenation in all ventilated ICU patients with severe ARDS.
PEEP should be adjusted according to the table on ardsnet.org in dependence of the FiO2 required to achieve adequate oxygenation in all ventilated ICU patients with severe ARDS.

name.value: Periodic Assessment of Sedation Level, Analgesia Level and Delirium Status

description.value: Sedation Level, Analgesia Level and Delirium Status should be assessed at least once in each shift (time-slots 6-14, 14-22, 22-6) in all Intensive Care Patients.
All Intensive Care Patients that don't have a no-mobilization order should be mobilized at least once every day.

name.value: Periodic Structured Communication with Patients and/or Relatives

description.value: For all Intensive Care Patients, at least one structured communication with the Patients and/or their Relatives should take place every week.
Plateau Pressure should be limited to a maximum of 30 cmH2O in all invasive ventilated ICU patients with severe ARDS.
The number of pneumonia cases per ventilated patients should be low.
Intensive Care Patients

name.value: Population: Intensive Care Patients without a no-mobilization order

description.value: Intensive Care Patients without a no-mobilization order
Sedation should be assessed once between 6 AM and <2 PM every day.
Sedation should be assessed once between 2 AM and <10 PM every day.
Sedation should be assessed once between 10 PM and <6 AM every day.

name.value: Sedation Level, Analgesia Level and Delirium Status in acceptable ranges.

description.value: Sedation Level, Analgesia Level and Delirium Status should be in acceptable ranges.
All Intensive Care Patients with invasive devices should have a daily re-evaluation regarding the necessity of each device.
Every day, all Non-Adipose Intensive Care Patients should receive the amount of Calories that match their daily individual requirements.

name.value: The daily calorie intake is sufficient

description.value: The daily amount of calories matches the individual requirements.
Tidal volume should be limited to a maximum of 6 ml/kg ideal body weight in all invasive ventilated ICU patients with severe ARDS.

name.value: Weekly Communication with Patients and Relatives

description.value: At least one structured communication with the Patients and/or their Relatives takes place every week.
